columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: The application that the job ran. This value is autodetected based on the job executable path. A value of uncategorized indicates that the executable path was not recognized as a community application. A value of PROPRIETARY is shown for any application that has a non-open licence agreement that may restrict publishing of performance data. NA means not available.

columns.name: cwd_id
columns.comment: The working directory where the main job executable was launched.

columns.name: datasource_id
columns.comment: The software used to collect the performance data.

columns.name: end_time_ts
columns.comment: The time that the job ended.

columns.name: executable_id
columns.comment: The full path to the main job executable.

columns.name: exit_status_id
columns.comment: The exit status of the job reported by the job scheduler. The meaning of this field depends on the job scheduler.

columns.name: granted_pe
columns.comment: number of granted processing elements (i.e. wayness)

columns.name: jobname_id
columns.comment: foreign key to the jobname table.

columns.name: local_job_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier assigned to the job by the job scheduler.

columns.name: nodecount_id
columns.comment: foreign key to the nodecount table.

columns.name: organization_id
columns.comment: The organization that owns the resource on which the job ran.

columns.name: resource_id
columns.comment: The resource that ran the job.

columns.name: start_time_ts
columns.comment: The time that the job started running.

columns.name: account
columns.comment: The name of the account or project (also known as a charge number).

columns.name: account_id
columns.comment: The name of the account or project (also known as a charge number).

columns.name: cores
columns.comment: The total number of cores assigned to the job.

columns.name: cores_avail
columns.comment: Total number of cores present on the nodes on which the job ran.

columns.name: cpu_time
columns.comment: The total CPU core time. This value is calculated as number of assigned cores multiplied by duration if not provided by the scheduler.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The name of the job as reported by the job scheduler.

columns.name: nodes
columns.comment: The number of nodes that were assigned to the job.

columns.name: person_id
columns.comment: The name of the job owner.

columns.name: person_organization_id
columns.comment: The name of the organization of the job owner.

columns.name: piperson_organization_id
columns.comment: The organization of the job owner's PI.

columns.name: principalinvestigator_person_id
columns.comment: The PI of the job owner.

columns.name: queue_id
columns.comment: The name of the queue to which the job was submitted.

columns.name: requested_nodes
columns.comment: The number of nodes requested at job submission time. This value will be zero if the user did not specify the number of required nodes or if this information is not provided for the resource.

columns.name: shared
columns.comment: Whether the job ran on a node that ran at least one other job.

columns.name: systemaccount_id
columns.comment: The username on the resource of the user that ran the job. May be a UID or string username depending on the resource.

columns.name: tg_job_id
columns.comment: the local job id

columns.name: wall_time
columns.comment: The wall-clock duration of the job.

columns.name: block_sda_rd_bytes
columns.comment: The average amount of data read per node from block device sda.

columns.name: block_sda_rd_bytes_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average data read from block device sda

columns.name: block_sda_rd_ios
columns.comment: The average number of read operations per node for block device sda.

columns.name: block_sda_wr_bytes
columns.comment: The average number of bytes written per node to block device sda.

columns.name: block_sda_wr_bytes_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average data written to block device sda

columns.name: block_sda_wr_ios
columns.comment: The average number of write operations per node for block device sda.

columns.name: catastrophe
columns.comment: indicator L1D cache load drop off (smaller is worse)

columns.name: cpiref
columns.comment: The number of cpu clock ticks per instruction on average per core.

columns.name: cpiref_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average CPI for each core

columns.name: cpldref
columns.comment: The ratio of clock ticks to L1D cache load on average per core. The CPLD is calculated using the reference processor clock.

columns.name: cpldref_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average CPLD for each core

columns.name: cpu_idle
columns.comment: The ratio of idle cpu time to total cpu time for the cores that the job was assigned.

columns.name: cpu_system
columns.comment: The ratio of system cpu time to total cpu time for the cores that the job was assigned.

columns.name: cpu_user
columns.comment: The ratio of user cpu time to total cpu time for the cores that the job was assigned.

columns.name: cpu_user_cv
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation for the CPU user for all cores that were assigned to the job.

columns.name: cpu_user_imbalance
columns.comment: max - min / max cpu user over all cores job ran on

columns.name: eligible_time_ts
columns.comment: The time that the job was ready to be run by the scheduler.

columns.name: energy
columns.comment: An estimate of the amount of energy consumed by the compute nodes on which the job ran. This value does not include the energy used by any external cooling equipment. Nor does it include the energy usage of other components such as filesystem servers and network switches

columns.name: error
columns.comment: a string

columns.name: flops
columns.comment: The total number of floating point operations on average per core

columns.name: flops_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average FLOPS for each core

columns.name: gpu0_nv_mem_used
columns.comment: average memory used by gpu i averaged across nodes, only support nvidia.  Could be multiple cards per machine of different types

columns.name: gpu0_nv_utilization
columns.comment: average % utilization of the gpu

columns.name: gpu_energy
columns.comment: An estimate of the amount of energy consumed by the GPU devices that were assigned to the job. This value does not include the energy used by the compute nodes or any other components external to the GPU cards.

columns.name: gpu_max_power
columns.comment: An estimate of the maximum power consumption of the GPU card with the largest maximum power consumption during the job.

columns.name: ib_rx_bytes
columns.comment: number of bytes received per node over the data interconnect

columns.name: max_memory
columns.comment: Maximum ratio of memory used to total memory available for the compute node with the highest peak memory usage

columns.name: max_power
columns.comment: An estimate of the maximum power consumption of the compute node with largest maximum power consumption during the job.

columns.name: mem_transferred
columns.comment: total data transferred over the memory bus

columns.name: mem_transferred_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average memory transferred for each socket

columns.name: mem_used_including_os_caches
columns.comment: Total memory used by the OS including the page and buffer caches. This is the sum of all the memory used on all of the nodes.

columns.name: mem_used_including_os_caches_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average memory in use by the OS

columns.name: memory_used
columns.comment: Process memory used. This value indicates the memory used by all processes including system services. It does not include the memory used by the OS page or buffer cache. This is the sum of all the process memory on all of the nodes.

columns.name: memory_used_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average memory used

columns.name: net_eth0_rx
columns.comment: number of bytes received by network via network interface i averaged across nodes, i.e. net.ib0.rx_bytes

columns.name: net_eth0_rx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes received by the network device eth0 for each node.

columns.name: net_eth0_rx_packets
columns.comment: number of packets received by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: net_eth0_tx
columns.comment: number of bytes transmitted by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: net_eth0_tx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes transmitted by the network device eth0 for each node.

columns.name: net_eth0_tx_packets
columns.comment: number of packets transmitted by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: net_ib0_rx
columns.comment: number of bytes received by network via network interface i averaged across nodes, i.e. net.ib0.rx_bytes

columns.name: net_ib0_rx_packets
columns.comment: number of packets received by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: net_ib0_tx
columns.comment: number of bytes transmitted by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: net_ib0_tx_packets
columns.comment: number of packets transmitted by network via network interface i averaged across nodes

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx
columns.comment: total number of bytes received per node from the gpfs filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes read from the gpfs parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages received by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.rx_msgs

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_tx
columns.comment: number of bytes transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_bytes

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_tx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes written to the gpfs parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_tx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_msgs

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx
columns.comment: total number of bytes received per node from the isilon filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes read from the isilon parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages received by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.rx_msgs

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_tx
columns.comment: number of bytes transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_bytes

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_tx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes written to the isilon parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_tx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_msgs

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx
columns.comment: total number of bytes received per node from the panasas filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes read from the panasas parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages received by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.rx_msgs

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_tx
columns.comment: number of bytes transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_bytes

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_tx_cov
columns.comment: Coefficient of variation of the average bytes written to the panasas parallel filesystem for each node.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_tx_msgs
columns.comment: number of messages transmitted by network drive i averaged across nodes, i.e. lnet.-.tx_msgs

columns.name: node_cpu_idle
columns.comment: The average CPU idle for all of the CPU cores on the nodes that were assigned to the job. For jobs that were assigned all cores on the nodes this value will be identical to the CPU Idle value.

columns.name: node_time
columns.comment: Total node time. This value is calculated as number of assigned nodes multiplied by duration if not provided by the scheduler.

columns.name: requested_wall_time
columns.comment: The requested job duration.

columns.name: submit_time_ts
columns.comment: The time that the job was submitted to the job scheduler.

columns.name: username
columns.comment: The username on the resource of the user that ran the job. May be a UID or string username depending on the resource.

columns.name: wait_time
columns.comment: The amount of time between job submit and job start.
